ContentCategory.name: bpsom
ContentCategory.briefDescription: Business Process Service Oriented Methodology (BPSOM) provides a guide for service oriented development from business processes, that can be added as a plug-in to the existing base software development process of the organization. It provides guides to derive and generate services models specified in OMG SoaML standard from business process specified in OMG BPMN standard. It also provides the definition of QVT transformations to automate this derivation as much as possible, using the Eclipse environment.

Presentation.name: new_custom_category,_kFPmEOsbEeWqcvoXZGkk6w
Presentation.MainDescription:
Business Process Service Oriented Methodology (BPSOM) provides a guide for service oriented development from business processes, that can be added as a plug-in to the existing base software development process of the organization. The objective is to use the way in which people work as the basis for the software development adding specific elements to guide the generation of services from business processes.

 

BPSOM defines activities, deliverables and roles in three key Disciplines: Business Modeling, Design and Implementation, and a lifecycle based on the Unified Process (UP) to guide the development in an iterative and incrementally way.

The activities defined in the Business Modeling Discipline emphasize the definition and modeling of business processes (using the BPMN OMG notation standard) not only as first input for the development process but as key asset of the organization.

From these models, the activities defined in the Design Discipline guide the service oriented development by identifying services from activities, sub-process or complete business processes, specifying them including interfaces provided and required, parameters, pre and post conditions, among others. 

A specific activity is defined to reuse existing services in the organization, complete or parcially, then to assign components to defined services and to specify services interaction, in choreographies or orchestrations depending on the business process control flow. Finally services realizing business processes, as defined in the Design Discipline, are implemented in the Implementation Discipline.

General activities from the base software development process are assumed to exist to carry out needed activities such as the requirements capture, or the software testing and deployment.

ContentElement.name: investigate_existing_services
ContentElement.briefDescription: To find services that are already implemented in the organization and can be reused in the application under development.To keep track of the services, their contracts and associated software systems (implementation) are register in a central Services Catalogue of services.

Presentation.name: ,_QjnCIOvOEeW3MJIMM8_7UQ
Presentation.MainDescription:
Existing services could be reused as if or it could be necessary to implement intermediary services for reusing other services that are not completely suited to the application, which is preferable than implement them again from scratch. To keep track of the services, their contracts and associated software systems (implementation) are register in a central Services Catalogue of services. In the SoaML component diagram an adapter or wrapper has to be defined to relate the design service to its existing implementation, which will then be linked in Activity D4. If the service can be used as it is, then the functionality of the adapter will be solely to call the existing component that implements the service; if it is similar then the adapter will add or modify the existing functionality to suite the new requirements for the service.

Example of wrapper definition taken from the SoaML standard:
Presentation.KeyConsiderations: An adapter or wrapped component is defined in the SoaML component diagram for the participant, to invoke the existing service, adding or modifying functionality if needed.

Section.name: Identify existing services providing the required functionality listed in the services Catalogue
Define if the existing service could be used as is or if it is necessary to implement intermediary services
If an intermediary service has to be implemented, define the functionality it will reuse from the existing service, and the functionality that has to be added
Identify the location and way to invoke the existing service
New Step

Presentation.Purpose: To find services that are already implemented in the organization and can be reused in the application under development.

ContentElement.name: identify_categorize_services
ContentElement.briefDescription: To identify the services needed to perform the business processes modeled in the Business Modeling Discipline, classifying them by type of service. To define the Services Architecture diagram specified in OMG SoaML standard identifying participants, services to be provided to other parties and consumed from other parties based on interchanged messages, and service contracts to define the roles in the services interaction. The BPMN business process models has to be marked with additional information such as defining as 'Service' the type of the activities to be supported by services, to be generated by means of the defined QVT transformations from BPMN to SoaML.

Presentation.name: ,_GvbLQOvOEeW3MJIMM8_7UQ
Presentation.MainDescription:
Services represent features related to business concepts, business process and their sub-processes and required functionalities, which have to be provided by services mapped to software subsystems. The use of SoaML in this activity implies defining the Services Architecture (SA) diagram which specifies the participants, the contracts for the services and the roles they play in each one as provider or consumer of the service. To identify the services to support the business process, we look at each interchanged message between the pools, first defining which activities will be supported by services, and setting the activity type to “Service”. This identification is carried out from the point of view of the provider of the service. Upon considering the direction of the interchanged messages, we therefore define that the activity to which the message is an incoming message is that to be supported by a service. The activity from which the message is an outcoming message is therefore the consumer of the service. The pool containing each activity will define the participant that provides or consumes the service, depending on where the activity is supported or invokes the defined service. This information will then be set in the Service Contract for the defined service, indicating the consumer and provider roles as defined. For each general Participant, its internal participants are also identified in correspondence with its internal defined Lanes, and the internal Architecture for the Participant corresponding to the organization in which the development effort is carried out, can be later defined using an specific Service Architecture diagram for that participant only. QVT transformations are defined to generate services models specified in the OMG SoaML standard from business process models specified in BPMN, that can be executed in the Eclipse environment. 


SoaML Services Architecture diagram for the Reseller business process:



 


Other view in the Services Architecture diagram shows some of the participants defined along with their ports for providing (Service) and consuming (Request) identified services, and its interfaces (provided and consumed) corresponding to each port.   

The categorization of services into a conceptual hierarchy is helpful for avoiding their proliferation in an indiscriminate manner, which is known as "services syndrome", and can be done analyzing the service obtained (atomic, composed).

Section.name: Identify services provided by the organization from the business process message flow
Identifiy services consumed by the organization from the business process message flow
Identify activities involved in the business process message flow that need software support and mark them with 'Service' BPMN stereotype in the BPMN model.
Clearly define the functionality associated to the identified service
Classify the service according to the hierarchy used indicating if it is atomic or composed
Identify internal services in the organization needed to fullfil the external services provided and consumed
New Step

Presentation.Purpose: To identify the services needed to perform the business processes modeled in the Business Modeling Discipline, classifying them by type of service. To define the Services Architecture diagram specified in SoaML identifying participants, services to be provided to other parties and consumed from other parties based on interchanged messages, and service contracts to define the roles in the services interaction.

ContentElement.name: assign_services_to_components
ContentElement.briefDescription: To define the components to be implemented for providing the specified services. For each service, it is necessary to define a component with which to implement it. This might be an atomic component, an existing component, or a composite component which uses or has several other internal components. In SoaML it means modeling the participant component diagram with which to define the implementation of participants and services.

Presentation.name: ,_uf9WkOvNEeW3MJIMM8_7UQ
Presentation.MainDescription:
To assign services to components the question of whom (which component) will be provided for the services defined by the specified interfaces must be answered. The existing services also count if there are components providing the required functionality, or if an intermediary service could be developed to provide it using existing services. For each service, it is necessary to define a component with which to implement it. This might be an atomic component, an existing component, or a composite component which uses or has several other internal components. The Architect uses the information concerning existing services found in the catalogue, and the definitions of the service design to associate each component with the service that it will implement. In SoaML it means modeling the participant component diagram with which to define the implementation of participants and services, defining the new components to be generated and, if the component exists, defining adapters or wrappers to use it, providing the modifications needed to invoke them.

Example of component diagram taken from the SoaML standard:

Section.name: Define components to be implemented fot providing the specified services
Specify each component indicating the services and business rules it implements
Identify other components that the specified component uses
New Step

Presentation.Purpose: To define the components to be implemented for providing the specified services. In SoaML it means modeling the participant component diagram with which to define the implementation of participants and services.

ContentElement.name: define_services_interaction
ContentElement.briefDescription: To define the sequence of interaction between services needed to perform the identified business processes, clarifying the interaction of services.

Presentation.name: ,_5DEwAOvNEeW3MJIMM8_7UQ
Presentation.MainDescription:
The invocation sequence of services is shown for each process or sub-process in a sequence diagram describing the interaction between the services involved. It will be an orchestration of services if there is an organization that controls its, or a choreography if it involves more than one organization in a collaborative process with pre-defined communication with other parties.This insight is provided by a sequence diagram showing all the services, or various sequence diagrams showing different subsets of services corresponding to different sub-processes in the business process.    

Example of a sequence diagram showing an interaction of services for the sub-process "Loan Authorization" from a "Grant Loan" business process of a bank:

Section.name: For each identified business process or sub-process trace the defined services implementing the selected activities
Create the corresponding sequence diagram to realize each business process by means of the defined services
In the sequence diagram the entities will be the defined services and the actors will be persons or organizations involved
New Step

Presentation.Purpose: To define the sequence of interaction between services needed to perform the identified business processes,  clarifying the interaction of services.

ContentElement.name: specify_services
ContentElement.briefDescription: To specify services by defining for each one its contract with the interfaces it provides and its operations and parameters. To define all the information for modeling the service in SoaML using the diagrams for Service Contract, Interfaces and associated Choreograpy.

Presentation.name: ,_c_UU4OvOEeW3MJIMM8_7UQ
Presentation.MainDescription:
The specification of services corresponds to the definition of all the information needed to further implement them. This includes all the information in the defined Service Contract: interfaces, operations, input and output parameters, and pre and post conditions if needed. Each operation in the interface must specify: a) name of the method, b) required parameters and for each one, its name, type and description, c) return value, indicating name, type and description, d) list of exceptions, e) brief description of the provided functionality, f) pre-conditions for the successful execution, g) post-conditions that have to be valid after execution. The information related to the in and out messages must be specified, indicating the parameters and data to be interchanged between the parties.

Message Type definitions to be used in operations from the Reseller:

The choreography defined by the Service Contract (if any) must also be specified, based on the interaction between participants, interfaces, operations and parameters used.  Service Contract with roles definition and corresponding choreography for the defined service ReceiveOrder of Reseller.  

 

In order for services to be generated in SoaML from the BPMN business process model with this information, the Architect must provide it in the BPMN business process model for the activities marked as services.

Section.name: Clearly specify the functionality that the service provides
Identify interface/s provided by the service
Identify operations provided by each interface
Identify input/output parameters in each operation indicating name, type and description
Identify pre-conditions for the service execution
Identify post-conditions for the service execution

Presentation.Purpose: To specify services by defining for each one its contract with the interfaces it provides and its operations and parameters. To define all the information for modeling the service in SoaML using the diagrams for Service Contract, Interfaces and associated Choreograpy.

Presentation.name: ,_x2n3wOvKEeW3MJIMM8_7UQ
Presentation.MainDescription: According to the software base development process of the organization the software system developed (including the services implemented) is deployed into the clients environment.
Presentation.Purpose: To deploy the software system developed into the clients environment.

Presentation.name: ,_eYkjoOvKEeW3MJIMM8_7UQ
Presentation.MainDescription: According to the software base development process of the organization the requirements for the software system under development are captured and documented.
Presentation.Purpose: To capture the requirements for the software system under development.

Presentation.name: ,_pQMNcOvKEeW3MJIMM8_7UQ
Presentation.MainDescription: According to the software base development process of the organization the services implemented are tested to find implementation errors and correct them before the deployment.

Section.name: Specify the testing cases according to the functionality defined for the service in the requeriments document
Test the service implemented regarding the specified testing cases and the information in the services document
New Step

Presentation.Purpose: To test the services implemented to find errors and be able to correct them before the deployment.

ContentElement.name: identify_business_processes
ContentElement.briefDescription: To understand and describe the business processes in the organization, mainly those related to the application being developed, specifying the business process models using the Business Process Modeling Notation (BPMN), including participants and actors involved, control flow with sequence of activities and messages between pools, flow decisions and business rules. The use of process patterns (workflow patterns) is recommended to help in various modeling aspects of business processes.

Presentation.name: ,_S7vpEOvMEeW3MJIMM8_7UQ
Presentation.MainDescription:
The business processes description must include: including participants and actors involved, control flow with sequence of activities and messages between pools, flow decisions and business rules. It is recommended to use process patterns (workflow patterns) to help in various modeling aspects of business processes. The boundaries of business are clearly stated, indicating who and what interacts with the organization, specifying processes both in natural language and graphically using a Business Process Modeler tool (BizAgi, ARIS, Visual Paradigm, etc.). QVT transformations are defined to generate services models specified in the OMG SoaML standard from business process models specified in BPMN, that can be executed in the Eclipse environment. 

Example of a BPMN busines process model for a Reseller (adapted from Weske, 2007):
Presentation.KeyConsiderations: It is recommended to use process patterns (workflow patterns, van der Aalst et. al, 2003) to help in various modeling aspects of business processes, reusing knowledge and best solutions.

Section.name: Identify participants and actors involved
Identify activities to be performed
Identify the sequence of activities realization
Identify decision nodes in the flow
Identify message interaction with other participants (if any)
Identify business rules
New Step

Presentation.Alternatives: The notation used to specify the business process models from which to generate SoaML services models is BPMN. Other notations could be used, but the QVT transformations defined could not then be executed.
Presentation.Purpose: To understand and describe the business processes in the organization, mainly those related to the application being developed, specifying the business process models using the Business Process Modeling Notation (BPMN).

ContentElement.name: asses_target_organization
ContentElement.briefDescription: The current state of the Organization in which the application will be implemented should be described, in terms of their current business processes, tools, skills of people, attitudes of people, customers, competition, technological challenges, problems and areas of improvement, among others.

Presentation.name: ,_FEF8wOvMEeW3MJIMM8_7UQ
Presentation.MainDescription: The current state of the Organization in which the application will be implemented should be described, in terms of their current business processes, tools, skills of people, attitudes of people, customers, competition, technological challenges, problems and areas of improvement, clearly identifying those stakeholders involved in the business modeling effort. The OMG Business Motivation Model (BMM) can also be used to express the goals, strategy and the organization’s other business information, which then is linked to the definition of SoaML services.
Presentation.KeyConsiderations: If the software area belongs to the organization then, if documents exist that provide the needed insight into the area of business, business goals, operation, employees, technologies used in the organization, among others, these can be used rather than their being produced again.

Section.name: Identify business processes context
Identify technological contex
Identify human context
Identify problems and improvement opportunities
Identify stakeholders for the business modeling effort

Presentation.Purpose: To involve the project team with the organization for which the development is being  carried out, in issues such as: the area of business, operation, employees, etc. of the organization.

Presentation.name: new_artifact,_2ftQ0OvMEeW3MJIMM8_7UQ
Presentation.Purpose: To specify business processes in the organization by means of business process models using a valid notation (Recomendded the Business Process Modeling Notation)

Presentation.name: new_artifact,_-1FAUOvMEeW3MJIMM8_7UQ
Presentation.Purpose: To clarify the organizational context in which the development project takes place.

Presentation.name: ,_EV6gwOvPEeW3MJIMM8_7UQ
Presentation.MainDescription: To implement the described services taking into account the type of service, the designed interfaces, the interaction with other services (with or without a repository of services, binding in development or execution time).

Section.name: For each service recall the defined interfaces with its operations, parameters, pre and post conditions from the services document
Implement the service defining if invocations to other services will be through a services repository or not, and the time of binding for the invocation (development, execution)
Implement the service defining how invocations to other software pieces will be handled, and the time of binding for the invocation (development, execution)
New Step

ContentElement.name: intro_bpsom
ContentElement.briefDescription: Business Process Service Oriented Methodology (BPSOM) provides a guide for service oriented development from business processes, that can be added as a plug-in to the existing base software development process of the organization. It provides guides to derive and generate services models specified in OMG SoaML standard from business process specified in OMG BPMN standard. It also provides the definition of QVT transformations to automate this derivation as much as possible, using the Eclipse environment.

Presentation.name: new_supporting_material,_vyeZQOvLEeW3MJIMM8_7UQ
Presentation.MainDescription:
Business Process Service Oriented Methodology (BPSOM) provides a guide for service oriented development from business processes, that can be added as a plug-in to the existing base software development process of the organization. The objective is to use the way in which people work as the basis for the software development adding specific elements to guide the generation of services from business processes.

 

BPSOM defines activities, deliverables and roles in three key Disciplines: Business Modeling, Design and Implementation, and a lifecycle based on the Unified Process (UP) to guide the development in an iterative and incrementally way.

The activities defined in the Business Modeling Discipline emphasize the definition and modeling of business processes (using the BPMN OMG notation standard) not only as first input for the development process but as key asset of the organization.

From these models, the activities defined in the Design Discipline guide the service oriented development by identifying services from activities, sub-process or complete business processes, specifying them including interfaces provided and required, parameters, pre and post conditions, among others. 

A specific activity is defined to reuse existing services in the organization, complete or parcially, then to assign components to defined services and to specify services interaction, in choreographies or orchestrations depending on the business process control flow. Finally services realizing business processes, as defined in the Design Discipline, are implemented in the Implementation Discipline.

General activities from the base software development process are assumed to exist to carry out needed activities such as the requirements capture, or the software testing and deployment.
